marketNews.title: HRTA Estimasi Penjualan Emas Batangan +30% YoY pada 1Q25
marketNews.content: Director of Investment Development at BPJS Ketenagakerjaan, Edwin Ridwan, told Reuters on Friday (11/4) that the institution plans to double its allocation to local equities to 20% of assets under management within three years. He noted that BPJS has been gradually increasing its equity investments, especially in large-cap stocks, since the recent decline of the IHSG. BPJS Ketenagakerjaan currently manages a social security fund of 48 billion USD, the largest institutional investor in Indonesia. Approximately 4.8 billion USD of the fund is invested in the stock market or through mutual funds. The Chinese government announced on 11 April 2025 that it will raise tariffs on all US-origin imports from 84% to 125% effective 12 April 2025. The announcement also stated that China will no longer consider further US tariff increases as the current level is economically unreasonable, and described the US tariff hikes as a "joke." This came one day after the US announced that total tariffs on Chinese imports had reached 145%. U.S. President Donald Trump, in a cabinet meeting on Thursday (10/4), said he would like to reach a trade deal with China to end the trade war. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent added that certainty on tariff policy would emerge after the United States reaches agreements with other countries. Spot gold closed up 1.27% at $3,216.11 per troy ounce on Friday (11/4), after reaching an intraday all-time high of $3,277.23 per ounce earlier the same day. The rise was driven by global uncertainty amid the escalating US-China trade conflict. The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) eased to an annual rate of 2.4% in March 2025 (down from 2.8% in February), below the consensus forecast of 2.6% and marking the lowest inflation since September 2024. On a month-over-month basis, CPI showed a deflation of 0.1% (versus a 0.2% increase in February), contrary to the consensus expectation of a 0.1% rise and representing the first monthly deflation since May 2020. Core inflation fell to 2.8% YoY and 0.1% MoM (down from 3.1% YoY and 0.2% MoM in February), also below consensus expectations of 3% YoY and 0.3% MoM, and marking the lowest core inflation year-on-year since March 2021. Minister of Cooperatives Budi Arie Setiadi said that establishing 80,000 Red-White village cooperatives will require a total funding of 400 trillion rupiah, and that these cooperatives will become suppliers for a free school-lunch program. Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs Zulkifli Hasan added that funding for the cooperatives will be arranged by the Ministry of Finance and the State-Owned Enterprises Ministry, and that the state-owned bank association (Himbara) will be involved in financing. Deputy Minister of Labor Emmanuel Ebenezer said the government is preparing regulations to guarantee that online-motorcycle-taxi and courier drivers receive an annual holiday bonus. Chairman of Shrimp Club Indonesia Andi Tamsil told Kontan that national shrimp sales have fallen by 20-30% since the United States announced a reciprocal tariff of 32% on Indonesian shrimp, noting that 90% of Indonesia's shrimp production is exported, with 70% of that going to the U.S. market.

tickerNews.title: WIFI plans Rights Issue of approximately Rp5.9 trillion
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital (WIFI) plans to conduct a rights issue of about 2.95 billion new shares at an execution price of 2,000 rupiah per share, with a ratio of 4:5 and a dilution effect of up to 55.56%. The potential proceeds from this plan are around 5.9 trillion rupiah, which will be used for capital contribution to its business entity, PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem, for the construction of Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) networks for 4 million homepasses on Java Island. As of the end of 2024, WIFI owned 99.7% of PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem. The rights will be cum-traded on the regular market and in negotiations on 11 June 2025, with the rights execution period from 17 to 23 June 2025. In a separate transaction, WIFI announced that Japanese telecommunications company Nippon Telegraph and Telephone East Corporation (NTT East) injected 4 trillion rupiah of capital into PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem, giving NTT East a 49% stake in the entity. On Friday (11/4), WIFI's share price closed up 13.6% at 2,250 rupiah per share. Key Takeaway: From the two corporate actions, PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem could receive a total of 9.9 trillion rupiah, allowing WIFI to pursue FTTH network development organically and through acquisitions. DealStreetAsia and Reuters reported in September 2024 that Link Net (LINK) and Indosat (ISAT) were exploring the sale of part or all of their fiber-optic businesses, with transaction values estimated at 400-500 million USD (6.6-8.3 trillion rupiah) and 1-2 billion USD (16.5-33 trillion rupiah) respectively. Overall, WIFI's profitability may decline due to the large expansion, as take-up rates are expected to be lower than the 2024 rate of over 90%, but growth potential could offset the profit pressure. If WIFI expands through acquisitions, investors should monitor the valuation of such deals.

tickerNews.title: HRTA estimates 30% YoY increase in bullion sales in 1Q25
tickerNews.content: Investor Relations Director of Hartadinata Abadi (HRTA), Thendra Crisnanda, told Bloomberg that the company estimates its bullion sales will jump about 30% year-on-year in the first quarter of 2025, marking the steepest quarterly increase since the company went public in 2017.

tickerNews.title: ENRG targets 10-15% YoY increase in oil and gas production in 2025
tickerNews.content: Investor Relations Advisor of Energi Mega Persada (ENRG), Herwin W. Hidayat, said the company aims to increase oil and gas production by 10-15% year-on-year in 2025, allocating capex of about 150-170 million USD for the year. In 2024, ENRG recorded gross oil production of 8,097 barrels per day (+22% YoY) and gross gas production of 229 million cubic feet per day (-7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PTPP targets 7-11% YoY increase in new contract value and 19-23% YoY net profit growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: PT PP (PTPP) targets a 7-11% year-on-year increase in new contract value in 2025 and aims for net profit growth of 19-23% YoY, according to its annual report. This is higher than the 5% YoY contract growth mentioned by PTPP's Corporate Secretary Joko Raharjo in January 2025. The company also expects its total interest-bearing debt-to-equity ratio to improve by about 45% YoY in 2025 and proposes not to distribute dividends for fiscal year 2024.

tickerNews.title: MAIN proposes 2024 dividend payout ratio around 30% (~146.4 billion IDR)
tickerNews.content: Management of Malindo Feedmill (MAIN) proposes a dividend for fiscal year 2024 with a payout ratio of about 30%, implying a dividend of 146.4 billion rupiah or 65 rupiah per share. The proposal will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 22 May 2025. Based on MAIN's closing price of 720 rupiah per share on Friday (11/4), the implied dividend yield is approximately 9%.

tickerNews.title: AVIA shareholders approve final dividend of 11 IDR per share and plan up to 1 trillion IDR buyback
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Avia Avian (AVIA) approved a final dividend of 11 rupiah per share on Thursday (10/4). The cum-date and payment date have not been disclosed. Based on AVIA's closing price of 400 rupiah per share on Friday (11/4), the implied final dividend yield is about 2.8%. Previously, AVIA also distributed an interim dividend of 11 rupiah per share in November 2024. In addition to the dividend, shareholders approved a share buyback program with a budget of up to 1 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: NICL insider Christopher Sumasto Tjia purchases 3.2 million shares at 324 IDR each
tickerNews.content: Christopher Sumasto Tjia, controlling shareholder of PAM Mineral, bought 3.2 million shares of NICL at a price of 324 rupiah per share on 10 April 2025. The total transaction value is approximately 1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Christopher Sumasto Tjia's direct ownership in NICL increased from 0.039% to 0.07%.

tickerNews.title: HITS plans voluntary go-private and delisting, tender offer to be discussed at independent AGM on 21 May 2025
tickerNews.content: Humpuss Intermoda Transportasi (HITS) intends to go private and voluntarily delist, with the matter to be discussed at an independent shareholders meeting on 21 May 2025. The tender offer price has not been announced, and the voluntary tender is expected to take place between 13 June and 12 July 2025.
